description:
The five star is for how fluffy and delicious the pizza is. Definitely one of the best pizzas I have ever tried. 

The location is not the best. At night it was definitely a bit unsafe. (Homeless people outside on who knows what)
author: Alondra R.

description:
I'm completely disappointed. I ordered a pizza that should be half cheese and half with a toppings of Canadian bacon and pineapple. That cost about $14 and some change. But you guys gave me a WHOLE Hawaiian pizza. A whole Hawaiian pizza cost about $16.50 if I got that right. But I wanted just half of it yet you didn't give me what I ordered.

I also ordered a mozzarella sticks. It was slightly warm. Not sure if that should be enough reason why my mozzarella aren't soft anymore. They're like a clay exposed to air, you can see the break formation of the cheese. 

You just lost one of your usual customers. Disappointing, really.
author: Kat P.

description: I was starting to think that I'd never be able to order an affordably priced pizza in downtown SF until I discovered Chico's Pizza! I got an extra large Chico's Special with salami replaced with pineapple and it was only $22.50 with free delivery. The pizza was pretty decent, especially for its price. The crust had a similar thickness to costco's pizza, which I liked, and came with a good amount of cheese. Would recommend this place!
author: Granger L.

description: Was staying at the Hampton Inn on Mission which is a few blocks from Chico's and ordered pizza for deliver at 10:45 pm.  The delivery driver literally knocked on our hotel room door at 11 pm!!  My family was starving - we had just got back from a Golden State Warriors game so the fast delivery was much appreciated!!!
author: K S.

description:
Everyone knows 6th Street is about one of the most ugliest streets in San Francisco outside the Tenderloin, but nonetheless, there's always a diamond in the rough. 

Chico's Pizza, YOU are that diamond in the rough...

Diaaaaaamond in the ruffffffffff

It's super sketch on your walk to Chico's, but once you're inside, service is incredibly friendly and accommodating. 

Seating is extremely limited, but I doubt you'd want to sit around and hang out in that area anyway. 

They have a hot case of pre-made pizzas that you can order by the slice or you can also preorder a whole pie. Now, if you're buying more than two slices of pizza, I recommend buying a whole pizza because you'd get a better value for your money. Depending on the pizza you get, you pay $5-$6 per slice; whereas a whole large combination pizza is $23. A whole pizza offers about the same slice size comprised of about 8 pieces. And no joke, these slices are LARGE. Equivalent to Shaquille O'Neal's hand. 

It's better to pay cash rather than card because they do charge a dollar fee.

Delivery is available if you don't want to venture into skid row. 

Pizza here is really tasty if you enjoy thick crust pizza. Made fresh daily. Open super late too. For you late night munchers, find solace that this place stays open until 3am on Friday and Saturday, and midnight every other day of the week. 

Here's to being the Aladdin of pizza joints!
author: Ann S.

description: I am always going here for my pizza. There is no where as good or reasonably  priced. The guys who work there always have a smile and they are quick with it. The BEST!
author: Jeremiah M.

description:
First time here and in so happy the meatballs and pepperoni isn't not pork! Slices are really big which is awesome! My first time here but not my boyfriends. He loves this place! 
I got Hawaiian and combo. And my boyfriend got two combos. I will not finish he two slices lol I only got them for later as well. 

Love it here 2nd time! 3/5/17

Super quick service even tho it was busy. I got pineapple andy bf got pepperoni (of course no bed is here so I love that) 
Seriously best pizza place !
author: Brittany N.

description:
I Work 7 to 4pm  In San Francisco I can't trust most food. I'm going to get me a Chicos Pizza, combination please! I been going there sense. Imma get me a Slice to night. San Francisco Pizza Spot. McDonald's hell, Burger king, Chinese food, Mexican food, NO! 
CHICOS PIZZA PLEASE!
author: Glen W.

description:
I have never been to Chico's Pizza, but I have ordered delivery from there many times recently so I'm dropping a review.

When it comes to pizza delivery, you want the pizza to taste good, the ordering experience to be easy, and you want it timely. Well, the Yelp app has my orders saved so with a couple clicks I can order Chico's Special again and again and again. Chico's Special + a little parmesan and red pepper is my favorite thing right now.

The pizza has always arrived promptly, too; I last ordered from Chico's at 11:43pm on a whim and it arrived half an hour later. Usually, it's about 45 minutes. After that, I get to enjoy 8 delicious slices while watching some TV and I'm happy as hell.

ps. not a fatass just living up a dirty bulk XD
author: Patrick L.

description: Everything is always good.   Chicken wings,  Caesar salad, ultimate pizza .  Yummy   ...............
author: Marco M.

description: I ordered Chico's a couple of days ago and it's some of the best pizza I've ever had. Delivered so fast, I wasn't even ready for it. Will definitely be a returning customer
author: Mike D.

description:
Try the Calzone! It's Delicious! 

It's in a seedy location even though it's next to Monarch. However the employees are always respectful. 

Again the CALZONE is Great!
author: SayTin X.

description:
THEY HAVE THE BEST CALZONE IN THE CITY!

- Friendly & Respectful Staff
- Seedy area but it's great for late night slices after Monarch or Mezzanine
- AGAIN THE BEST CALZONE IN THE CITY! (Ask for side of Marinara sauce)

Please remember to be respectful to the staff, they are doing their best and deal with such a diverse crowd

Major Thanks!
author: Rosa L.

description:
The place matches the area. I actually did not see where they were located by ordering by a delivery app but this place does not have good pizza. The cheese is clumpy and flavorless. The sauce is sparse. And the crust is just as bad. 

I tried to fix it up with parmesan but there was no saving this mess. Being very hungry, I tried to enjoy it enough to eat but it was so bad. I began to get sick eating it. Such a waste. Please do not throw your hard earned money away. Try somewhere else
author: Pierre L.

description: Amazing pizza, friendly service, and fantastic variety!  I will definitely be coming back!!
author: Mēgan U.

description:
I always see the same guy there when I order my pizza, he is super nice, but don't know his name. I go here because it's one of the few places in my neighborhood that has gluten free pizza a regular pizza place type hours. The food is always ready from when I order and walk over to pick it up (about 10 mins). They really nice, food tastes great, and is a fair price (even though the GF is a bit expensive...)

The last two times I went I got 2 small gluten free (wish they had larger GF, but they don't offer it) pizzas. They're pretty small and I paid about $45 in total, but all in all pretty good za!
author: Joel F.

description:
Awesome pizza! The best tasting pizza for a very good price!
Fast delivery and great friendliness.
Will always go here when I crave a pizza.
author: Paige M.

description: It's my favorite pizza in town. Not expensive and very good. So yummy !! Try it. The location is not the must but I can do it for a great pizza..
author: Florian T.

description: Just tried them for the first time and I am pretty disappointed. They offered to replace the pizza when they got here but I am too pregnant and hungry to wait another hour...probably wouldn't order from here again. They should check their pizza before delivering it.
author: Adriana R.

description:
Hey SF neighborhood I hope you guys don't order food of here please I order the pizza more than 2 hours ago and I called them ask to delivery situation but they didn't say any apporozise and they didn't ask my information just say driver on the way and I'm still waiting now since 1pm. It is only 0.6mi far from my house. This store is so unkind and unfriendly 
So guys please do not order this store
author: Jonghyuk R.

description: Chico'a Calzone is the best.  Great to see delivery man back  Khader is the best.  Friendly with a great smile.  Super Nice Guy! Once you meet him you want him to deliver to you.  All the others are nice but Khader makes me smile too.
author: James P.

description:
Well, let's just say my buddy and I were craving some wings since we needed to sober up after the Giants game, and came across this place walking around. The 2 guys working the counter were friendly and let us know it would take about 10-15 minutes for the wings. During our time waiting, we witnessed several crazies come in and out of the place several times. At one point, one of the staff members had to raise his voice at a lady who was going all crazy and yelling weird things. I felt bad for them, being that this area is filled with homeless and mentally ill people. This area borders Tenderloin and is definitely a social economically depressed area of SF. At night time you can only imagine it gets worse, and that's when we were here. 

They made our wings in a timely manner and provided several small ranch containers for us. The wings were honestly very basic and didn't have much flavor, but since we had the drunk munchies, they probably were better than we thought they were. 

I wish we had tried the pizza, but I give credit to these guys who have to endure all the BS that goes on in the neighborhood with the local bums coming in and starting a raucous. 

Probably won't be back anytime soon, but this place is worth a shot if it's late and you're craving some pizza and a show!
author: Andrew P.

description: We ordered two pizzas the other night for delivery. The delivery arrived before the estimated time which is good but the estimated time was 1.5 hours, so take that as you will. The pizza was standard, not great not bad. Not sure if I'd order from here again.
author: Katlyn H.

description:
Couldn't believe I got an extra large cheese pizza delivered for just $22 including tip!

34 minutes later, the driver called up from downstairs to tell me he had arrived.

But mostly I order from Chico's because they contribute to this community, and they have always been friendly and helpful.

Oh yeah I ate cheese pizza for 4 days.
author: Matt T.

description: So occasionally get pizzas from @gofooji, Thanks fooji. What makes this place bad is the serious delays when it is delivered. And the last couple weren't.
author: M C.

description:
My friends were visiting from San Diego, we ordered a pizza in hopes for a hasty delivery. After about an hour of waiting, we decided to call and check the status of our delivery. In a very rude manner, the person picks up the phone and begins the conversation by yelling "YOU CALLED FIVE MINUTES AGO!" I had to clear up the misunderstanding as he mistaken me for a different order. After clearing that up, the person on the phone said "your pizza is on the way" and hung up without saying goodbye.

I would unequivocally deter from this establishment for their rude customer service and lack of punctuality as it took 1 hour and 45 minutes for our pizza to be delivered.
author: Marc P.

description: They never disappoint. Tonight I was craving Buffalo wings instead of pizza, their wings are delicioso! Customer Service was excellent as always. I highly recommend them! Let me add that if you are in SF and plan on having your Super Bowl Party catered or delivered, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Chico's Pizzas and Wings!
author: Sakkara C.

description: It was just like any other  Tuesday evening the first time I walked into chicos pizza on 6th st. But little did I know i was walking into one of the best pizza establishments in the city, possibly the world. The employees were all friendly and the food was great. I'll definitely be going back to chicos, and i highly recommend anybody craving pizza and a little entertainment from the community to do the same.
author: Joshua K.

description:
By far the best pizza in town .  Would have given it 5 stars but the location is less then desirable but if you order and take out you will be glad you did

Ok I need to do an update on my favorite pizza place in SF .  I've been ordering from Chico's for at least 15 years .  I always order delivery but tonight I was walking home and figured I would stop in .  They guys are the same ones that worked there for years and they recognized me all was good.  Placed my order .  True like my previous review the neighborhood which is bad has gotten much worse .  Can't blame them. A long 30 min sitting inside and got my food said bye guys and went home upon arriving I noticed that the pizza that was given to me was not what I ordered at all .  I always order the chicos special with extra meat,  Well what  I got was a cheese pizza with a few pepperonis on .  Mistakes happen so I called down there .  Told the guy on the phone what happened he told me i was wrong ? I know what's in front of me he says hold on .  I can hear him taking orders and doing. His job and let the phone just lay on the counter 7 min goes by he picks up the line and acts as if he is hearing this for the first time . I explained again and he was not listening to me because he kept saying what was that again. He puts me on hold again and 3 min of listening to him help other customers I just hung up .  I've been going there a long time and i even gave them a decent tip and I picked it up !   So hopefully they take the time to read this but I will have to make a decision soon on rather or not to continue doing business with them
author: Patrick S.

description: Always delicious, always consistent. Fast delivery, hot and fresh always! And extremely reasonably priced!
author: Dennis P.

description: I ordered a small pizza from here last night and not only did it take an hour and 40 min to get to me,but it was cold when we opened the box.... I'm very dissatisfied and will not be back. I'd rather eat dominos because at least it will be hot.
author: Mandy L.

description: Delivery was quick and service was awesome! Would recommend to out of towners visiting.
author: Albert V.

description:
Dam Great Slice of Inexpensive Pizza, But Absolutely Hell To Get To

SITREP

Chico's is totally in a ghetto neighborhood (6th & Mission) and the parking sucks - this really is a stop if you just happen to live nearby OR be walking past it like I was after the NERO show @ The Warfield this past Thursday Night.  

[And as it happened, my plan to park at the parking garage across the street from the Metreon (located @ 4th & Mission) for the NERO show at the Warfield, was *intercepted* by miraculously finding an open meter parking spot almost in front of Chico's (@ 6th & Mission), but I did not take note of Chico's until returning to the car almost 5 hours later)]. 

THE SETUP

But considering my two other regular pizza stops when clubbing in SF - Pizzelles's in North Beach @ Columbus & Broadway or DNA Pizza (part of DNA Lounge @ 11th & Harrison) - Chico's easily is the least expensive slice of these pizzerias.

MENU OPTIONS

They have a LOT of different pizza slices and the menu is quite extensive, with pastas & sandwiches as well:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chicos-pizza-san-francisco?select=IeDqvMfbwqDf8i0QhcEIwg

SLICE OPTIONS

I settled in on a slice of cheese ($2.95) and a slice of Chico's Combo Special ($3.95), and I would place it somewhere in between a deep dish style and a Sicilian style.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chicos-pizza-san-francisco?select=ZdqaGnu6tgQFEVqrwXU3HA

These other locations I mention would charge at least another $2 per slice.  However, again, "location location location", I don't think it's worth the hike to a more ghetto neighborhood if I'm already at the DNA Lounge or in North Beach to save $2 - $4.

THE LOWDOWN

Totally your call:  very good pizza, but you determine whether it's worth the effort to find this very inexpensive slice of pizza.
author: Michelangelo S.

description: Love Chicos and love that is just around my block! Always enjoy the specials and the place I spend my Eat24 coupon on Fridays, today we enjoy the wings a pizza even tho today is not Friday and i didn't use a coupon it was too hot to cook lol
author: Gaby R.

description: Only pizza I ever will buy in SF. Best and the closest thing , I'm able to get to a real east coast pizza. Much to my surprise . Chico n his crew, even know, what a real stromboli is too ! Which to me is proof enough . They know how to make the best here in the west! Love ya guys n thanks  Toni
author: Toni G.

description: We had a long long day of sight seeing. Ordered the meat lovers calzone from Chico's. It was fantastic. Delivery was less than thirty minutes and right to the hotel room. Hot and delicious. We would order from them again.
author: Cory J.

description:
Ordered the barbecue chicken and it was gooood! Loved it! The order arrived early. 
I was out of the house and hungry needed a quick fix and this pizza was just perfect but the delivery guy came with out paper towels/napkins. I had to walk to a coffee shop near by to pick up napkins which I thought was awkward and that's why I'm giving three stars. 
Other than that, I enjoyed the pizza.
author: Dee J.

description: Hella big slices of pizza for cheap so don't expect over the moon quality because it gets the job done. It's a gem on 6th.
author: Liza H.

description:
Been a customer of Chico's for a couple of years now since they're so close by. Based on delivery, I have to say though that over time, their service (forgotten my 2L soda a few times) and quality (pizza came cold at time despite only being less than a 5 minute drive from me) has gone down, but the pizza still taste good. I always order the Chico's special (combination) and when it's hot, it can be pretty darn good. Another I would suggest is the Seafood pizza if seafood is your thing. 

The Hawaiian and pesto pizzas are okay, nothing special or memorable. Overall this is a pretty decent pizza joint; they make their pizza fresh unlike some chain pizza stores. 

PARKING/LOCATION: street, it's a pretty busy area for cars so finding any street parking would be hard. Also be wary that the area in which this pizza place is located is pretty seedy.
author: Vivian S.

description: Best large single Slice pizza around SOMA. Just the right amount of cheese and sauce. Open late on weekends. Good quality and and great service! Love this pizza joint after a late night out in the city!
author: Syrus S.

description: Pizza slices were pretty huge! Prices aren't too bad . Just wished the pizza was a little crispy our slices came out too thick and doughy but other than that the workers were very nice and the pizza overall was still really good. Came here after a rave and loved how late they were open til.
author: Fabian T.

description: Pizza on point. I personally prefer thinner crusts and theirs just happen to be too thick for me. Pretty large slice for a single slice though.
author: Cee E.

description: Just. Awesome. Pizza. Good value, fresh ingredients and nice selection!
author: Sofiane F.

description:
They have not gotten my order right once. They took 20 mins to even get my to go order in the oven. If you want a mediocre slice to go, feel free. If you want anything else, go anywhere else in the city. I honestly don't know how it's possible for a restaurant to be so unorganized.

Update: their "bacon" is actually just ham. FYI.

Also, their employees are completely inept and rude. It's just pizza, people. It's not that hard.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
The pizza came promptly and was still hot! 

Bottom line: the Chico's Special Pizza did not disappoint!
author: Rie U.

description:
Great pizza, great service, awesome wings!

Ordered a family sized pizza ($19.50). Half Hawaiian, half Chico's Special. Wait was about 20 minutes. Toppings filled the top, meaning no slice got jipped! Pizza was yummy. Only thing I didn't like was the thick crust. Buffalo Wings were delicious. Not super spicy. Was cooked to perfection.

Will definitely be ordering pizza and wings here again if I am close by!
author: Benita M.

description: Ordered a pepperoni and mushroom pizza on Chase pay, got a plain cheese pizza when I waited. Each blames one another for this, but I can't be bothered.
author: Daniel A.

description: It's good. Especially, BBQ chicken pizza is awesome.
author: Jeong W.

description: This place used to have decent pizza, but last night I got a few slices and the dough was as thick as a Webster's dictionary. Pizza was all bread, minimal cheese and a hint of tomato sauce. I've had a better quality pie out the frozen section of a grocery store. This place is all about the cash and giving people low quality product. Needless to say I won't be going back.
author: Marcus E.

description: We have been waiting one hour and 30 minutes for a pizza and it's still not here. We're late to a party and we called them and they started yelling at us saying "they're busy". This is bs, would not recommend
author: Arshia S.

description: If you are new in the city (like me, I highly recommend this place). I order a delivery around 7pm and they came the time they told me in the Yelp app, everything was really good flavoring and came hot! The way I love to eat my pizza. Thank you guys for the service, I will call you guys again!
author: Valerie R.

description:
I love this pizza place! 

We order from them for work events but also when in the mood for a pizza and a movie night. The only reason i'm not giving them 5 stars is every time we order from them they never bring paper plates even when I order ~$300 worth of pizza and literally every other pizza place does this. I've asked them to bring them a couple times and they forget or say they didn't see the request. Other than that this place rules, but it would be rad to get plates when you're ordering 5+ pizzas.
author: S Z.

description: In an area where you can easily spend $30 to get a small pizza delivered - Chico's stands out in terms of service and value.  Very good pizza, easy delivery over a large area, and good customer service - at half the price of Amici's or Goat Hill.  Chico's is on speed dial on my phone for whenever we need a pretty good pizza that won't break the bank.
author: Ken P.

description:
The best pizza I've ever had and I've tried so many different spots throughout the Bay Area. The employees here are very friendly and they sure know how to bake a delicious masterpiece. 

Nice job Chico's! 5 stars all the way.
author: Taisir S.

description:
I hate walking here but their pizza is so good and the walk from my bfs house isn't far. 

Anyway, their pizza. Loooooove it. So good so cheesy!!! I love how the bread-sauce-cheese ratio is so balanced. My bf said they had a price increase but so we don't go as much but when we do, it's so worth it.
author: Lynn C.

description: Good pizza!  Crust was nothing special though.  Delivery was timely.  We ordered two medium for two adults and four kids.  Still had two pieces leftover.
author: Rachel P.

description:
Do you remember the end of "The Blair Witch Project" when the pushy girl keeps screaming and follows Mike downstairs. Then we see Mike standing in the corner, and she drops her camera and it keeps rolling. Remember that classic freak-out scene? I think that would be a typical evening at Chico's Pizza, only nobody would pay attention since you're more than likely to hear somebody screaming on that adventuresome block of 6th Street anyway. I guess I must be Mike in this allegory since I took my life into my own hands, walked briskly from Mission and decided to get a $5 slice of anything. I pointed at the Pepperoni Pizza (photo: http://bit.ly/1bdF0Ow) and smiled nervously, even though the staff here is amazingly cordial.

What I thought was semi-amusing is that I didn't ask for it to go, but they packaged it up in a box anyway figuring I wanted to get the hell out of Dodge. No, I like to live on the edge and decided to eat it at the empty counter toward the back wall. That was me standing in the corner. Did the Blair Witch possess me and make me wait to be murdered? Not really. The pizza was searingly hot and pretty good really. Thin crust, plenty of pepperoni and cheese. Four-star good? Well, I wouldn't go that far, a tad greasy for my faux-epicurean taste, but kudos to the server who gave me an extra half-slice (photo: http://bit.ly/15VeFAI). But of course, that meant I had to stand in the corner that much longer. Will this movie never end? (cue for a high-pitched movie scream) Oh wait, was that me?

FOOD - 3 stars...generous slices, kinda greasy but you can't beat the price
AMBIANCE - 1.5 stars...you're kidding, right?
SERVICE - 4 stars...courageously great attitudes from the staff
TOTAL - 3 stars...run, Ed, run!
author: Ed U.

description:
An oasis in the food desert also known as the 6th street corridor. This place is always packed and has a good deal on slices. Will even make slices to order if you take out. Their spinach salad is a staple and a healthy size for the price!

If you're getting delivery, be sure to get ground sausage on the pizza. De-lish! No experience with their other offerings. I get pizza from a pizza place, theres a sandwich shop practically next door if I want a sandwich(also by the name of Chico's). 

I never understand the people who go to an X restaurant and order Y&Z just to complain. If they were a sandwich shop, their name would be Chico's Pizza and Sandwiches. But it's just Chico's Pizza, it's yummy, but keep it simple.

Tip about the Neighborhood:  If you know anything about 6th street, this will fall on deaf ears, but if you're unfamiliar with the area don't: look around like ur lost, leave ur belongings unattended or do anything else that would otherwise make you look like a walking target. Walk like u know where ur going and dont be afraid to smile and say "sorry" if asked about something you dont want to pay attention to. Don't stop walking and don't entertain getting a "deal" from someone on the street. Unless you a dude that actually has street smarts, its just easier this way.
author: Sasha G.

description: I ordered Chico's a few hours before my lunch, to be delivered at 1:50pm in busy Union Square - and it came right on time. The pizza was perfect and hot, didn't taste like it had been sitting around (bless you lol). Great pizza, happy with the delivery service. Will order again!
author: Catherine O.

description: Had this pizza twice over the past few weeks. Great crust and on time delivery.  I'll definitely order again!
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Ordered takeout to watch the Warriors game with some friends.
Great idea to combo their pizza, wings and some beer to enjoy a great game.

Sadly, the food didn't hold up to the pressure. The pizza was passable. Not horrible. Not good either though.
The bbq wings were just horrific though. We didn't even bother finishing them.

Wouldn't order from here again. Delivery was on time. Price is great for the amount of food we got.
author: Toby B.

description:
I've lived on the adjacent block for 15 years. This is the kind of cheapie place you go as a bachelor because you don't have any food in the house and want a sandwich or slice of pizza. 

I just got a sandwich there for the third time and want to be very clear about what these folks fail to do. The menu says the sandwich comes with lettuce, tomato and onion (and jalapano although I can live without that). First time I order one, it was prepared with none of those. Hmm, well ok, I was hungry and whatever. The second time I ordered a sandwich I made a point of asking for the lettuce, tomato and onion since I really enjoy a sandwich with those things. However, on getting home there were none of those things. Tonight, and maybe it's my fault for continuing to go to this lousy place, I once again ordered a sandwich and asked with what I thought was a loud and clear voice for lettuce tomato and onion  On my way home I thought maybe I should look and see if they managed to put those simple things on my sandwich and of course they did not. I walked back and pointed this out to them and they stood around like a bunch of idiots as though they had never even thought that making a sandwich the way the menu offers or the way the customer requested was something a restaurant might do. Naturally I will not go back a fourth time and neither should you.
author: Sean F.

description: The pizza had good flavor, but the crust was not that great. I had it delivered so it may be the reason it was soft and on the soggy side. The chicken wings sucked, they were fatty and not good. Only BBQ available no hot wings. They failed at giving us any napkins and plates when delivering to hotel room. The speed of the delivery was good, about 30 mins from order to arrival.
author: Doug B.

description: Typically I like Chico's and I've been ordering them for a few years now. But tonight was the worst service I've ever received. I ordered 1 large pizza just before 7 pm. 1.5 hours later still no pizza, but it's raining, so I give them a call and was told it was out for delivery. That's fine, it's raining and traffic is a little slow. After 2.5 hours of no pizza, I call to cancel and the person doesn't apologize, try to compensate or seem to care about anything based on his tone. Pizza cancelled, and looks like I need a new place.
author: Sean R.

description:
Been waiting for my delivery through Eat24 for 90 minutes and my stomach is growling.  When I called the restaurant for an update, I was told the driver left, nothing more. Might pass out from hunger before (IF) my pizza arrives.

Update: lots of traffic due to parade. After a reheat, pizza was pretty good.
author: Penny D.

description:
If you like to wait over 1.5 hrs for pizza delivery and like cold pizza this would be a great place for you
I am only giving them 2 stars because the pizza actually arrived
author: Petar M.

description:
Pizza was okay, nothing to write home about. But the meatball sandwich was ridiculous. It was a sub roll with pizza cheese and, get this, the sausage crumbles from the pizza toppings mixed in. I'm not sure where these guys come from but if you order a meatball sub in Philly and someone sends this, well, let's say, you'll have a hard time sitting down with that "thing" sticking out from where the sun doesn't shine. 

If you can't do a meatball sub, take it off your menu and concentrate on what you can do better.
author: B T.

description: This place is garbage. I'm never going to order from here again. The bread on the pizza was soggy. Id rather eat digornos
author: Swanson U.

description: Afyer waiting more than an hour for the pizzas. It arrive and a simple order or 2 pizzas; 1 pepperoni and one cheese, they got me 2 pepperoni. Obviously the guy of the phone was in a hurry and too busy... Totally awful.
author: Cynthia I.

description:
Awesome pizza! My family and I were on vacation and just got done with a long exiting day in the city doing all the touristy things.  We got to our room at the W hotel and had some late night munchies for some pizza. Chicos pizza delivered their delicious pizza right to our room!  My family and I devoured our large Pepperoni Pizza and 20 piece wings witch were the bomb.com
I highly recommend this place
author: Lawrence R.

description: It's been 1 hr and 30 min. Pizza is not here yet.  9 pm weeknite... min traffic. Not a good first time experience! Reviews said fast delivery. I live less than 1 Mile.
author: Renee S.

description:
Haven't ordered anything else from their menu, but the pizza was really awesome. Crispy bottom, fresh meats and veggies and good delivery time and service. Huge slices if you go big too.

My jobs loves ordering from them.
author: Joe H.

description:
Uhmm, nothing much. I only ordered from this place because first We were very hungry, pizza place near home and it was a deal of 2 pizzas plus coke for twenty something dollars. 

We ordered and the phone guy said that would take 40 minutes to one hour delivery. Okay, past 1:10 and I think they forgot to make the order, so I talked to the phone guy and he said pay only $20, the pizza will be deliver in 20minutes. 

Okay, the pepperoni pizza is okay, very cheesy (good), little pepperoni and thick crust (don't like).
author: Kim K.

description:
This place is killer.

Amazing slices, and the Large One Topping Pizza Deal is outstandingly priced.

I'll hop on Eat24, place my order, then slowly meander down to this great establishment. It takes about 45 minutes to get these puppies all buttered up and delicious... I don't mind waiting for perfection. 

The other great part would have to be the folks who are in this place. Always super polite and attentive. Not being in the very best of areas of SF, it would be understanding if they became a little harsh... but that's not the case. These dudes look you in the eye and take care of every person that comes through the door. For that, I'm far more in love with this place.

So if you want the soul of a solid pizza by the slice, not one that's simply cashing out, this is the legit spot to be.

Kudos to these guys.
author: Cameron W.

description:
So we've been trying to make this our go to pizza place but the delivery is terrible.  Delivery time averages 90 to 120 minutes from order and the drivers call and lie about where their at and rarely will leave their car.  They charge a $5 delivery fee and then if you tip....it's close to $10.

Sorry Chico's but me and my family are done waiting for your driver's to circle the block while we figure out what car has pizza in it.....

Today it took 90 minutes to get a call they were here and 15 minutes to figure out what car they were in.

Best of luck Chicos.  I've given you $300 for pizza and you don't seem to care.
author: Jason M.

description: It'll satisfy your pizza craving, but it wasn't the best. I will say that you can tell that the dough is fresh. But the sauce and the other ingredients need to be upgraded.
author: Sammy C.

description:
Although the pizza was decent by the slice, I am not recommending you ever come here. This is 6th Street and this place was swarming with crackheads at 2:30 a.m. This place is so real, you should really stay away. 

After leaving a downtown club and parking on 6th Street, we headed back to the car when our french guests were hungry.  I really didn't want to go in, but we did. 

There was a line, but all you need to do to get service is act like a fool. They shuffled two customers through the line before us, so we let them go. This guy was short .50, so we took care of that too. 

He walks outside and two seconds later is back in and done with his pizza. One of my friends made the remark that he must have been hungry. That's when he mentions that he had not eaten in days and shared the slice with two other guys. My friend felt bad for him and gave him $5 for another slice and a drink. 

After we left, my friends were left with the feeling that we left "New Jack City".  I was pretty embarrassed to have brought them here, but they wanted to go. The pizza just aint worth the effort, unless you enjoy the entertainment.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Well, the delivery time was the estimated 45 mins. The food all came hot. The delivery guy was nice.

The food, however, was pretty much bland. I DID like the chicken in the chicken salad. I also got a chico's special pizza. The pizza was pretty much tasteless. I was told this pizza was good, but not if you get delivery. 

Maybe one day I'll feel brave walking through the sea of crackheads to try their spot out.

Not such a good place so far.
author: Melissa S.

description: I order food from these guys and when the guy showed up he was high has a kite.  Dude couldn't even speak properly.  When I was waiting for him to give me my order he goes to the trunk of the car and says "Cheeeeeeeese pizzzza". I'm like no I ordered wings where the wings. "Oh, I'll beeeee baaack in 15 mins". WTF?  Naw man I'm good cancel my order I've already waited over an hour I don't want to wait another hour.  Straight BS man.
author: Raul V.

description: I ordered a pizza from them 2 weeks ago it was really good tonight I ordered and it took 2 hours to come as well as when they got here it was uncooked and freezing cold when I called the company to complain about my calzone no one can help me no one could even speak English, not to mention this calzone is a small and it cost $15. 15 dollars that is now wasted because I am at work with no oven to heat it up I was on my lunch break and got really hungry guess I'll be starving tonight horrible service if I could rate them 0 stars I would.
author: Bridgette T.

description:
I ordered via Eat24 for next day delivery @ specified time. Day of, the time came & no pizza. I figured I'd give them 15m with FiDi traffic. 

After 30m past I call them & they told me they're on the way (like many restos do). 

After an hour i call again to speak to the manager. The manager, Sal said his delivery driver woke late & lived in the east bay blah, blah... I told him the pizza was for a business meeting & he should have notified me of lateness. Sal said he was so sorry but offered nothing to rectify.

We got our pizzas 75m after the specified time & bordering on cold food.

Poor business practice!
author: McCracken C.

description:
I would have given them 3 stars but a roach fell out of my pizza box. 

The pizza was good otherwise. Nothing to write home about.
author: Jesse R.

description: You order a pizza after a long day and night of partying through the city. The guy on the other end of the phone tells you that your pizza would be delivered in 45-50 minutes. 1 1/2 hours later you find yourself sitting on your couch at 2:20AM. You have nothing in the fridge because its a rental, and NO PIZZA because some ahole never delivered it. Suck it Chico Pizza.
author: Brian F.

description:
They're two blocks from my house and it took two hours after ordering delivery and then charging my card for them to tell me they aren't delivering anymore. Second time this has happened. 

Any pizza other than pepperoni is disgusting from this place too.
author: Andrew D.

description: i'm a huge fan of Chicos Pizza this is the first time I've actually try this one. I like The other one in the tenderloin. Believe it or not their food is better I don't know why or how, it just is. though I am basing this review on one of experience. I'll give it a second shot
author: Grant S.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza delivery places in San Francisco! The deliveries always come on time and it's both tasty and reasonably priced. Besides the pizzas, I love the sammies and jalapeño poopers!
author: Ashley G.

description:
I eat at a lot of pizza places, and this is one of the best.  I tried a combo slice, which had a semi-thick crust that was just the right amount of crunch, with a delicious pizza sauce, and high quality toppings.

The price was very reasonable, and the service was good.  I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a delicious pizza.
author: Tristan R.

description: This has always been a reliable pizza joint for me, only on rare occasions have i ever had an issue. Maybe 3 times in the past 2+years and they were corrected immediately and professionally.  Great big slices of pizza and a satisfying assortment of other foods should you feel up to it.  I highly recommend them.
author: Zoëy B.

description: I ordered a medium pizza from here and it took them nearly two hours to deliver!!! I literally fell asleep and woke up 2 hours later and the delivery guy was just coming to my door!! He apologize for the extreme delay but yea, I'm not a fan. Never ever ever again!!!
author: Jermaine J.

description: Very friendly and delivered fairly quickly for a saturday night.  not my first choice, but not horrible.
author: Isaac A.

description:
Pizza arrived on time.
It tasted great (I like doughy pizzas and this was perfect) the prize was amazing, 2 medium pizzas for almost $30

They actually read my comment and added pineapple instead of onions (I couldn't see the pineapple option in the selection, so I added the extra onions hoping they'd change the request and they DID ! :D )
Definitely my new pizza for delivery option, super recommended
author: Mary G.

description:
Great pizza, solid delivery, better price. I'll be back :)

I had a lot of meat toppings and they tasted fresh, not the bad frozen kind you'll find elsewhere. Cheese was delicious and they were courteous over the phone.
author: Alex K.

description:
Probably the best value for pizza delivery in SF in that you get a lot of food for less than the competitors. But the pizza is only average. Way too much bland crust. Toppings were solid, but not enough to tip it into 4-star territory.

Also ordered a salad which was really good. Best part of the experience.

Delivery driver made me go downstairs to get the pizza, even though we have someone at the door to let you up.

Order if you're feeling poor and not too picky.
author: Laurel K.

description: Chicos is the bestttt! And trust me, I am a pizza fanatic who loves fresh pizza! Shoutout to the Chicos on 6th street for always making my pizzas super fresh!
author: Natalie B.

description:
Delivery took 2 hours and 15 minutes on a quiet Monday afternoon.  The delivery driver's excuse was he had to circle the block to find parking because of construction.  But the restaurant is only 5 blocks away from where I had it delivered.  Couldn't he have just walked if parking was that bad?  I didn't even order pizza, just cake and mozzarella sticks and bread (don't judge ).

After an hour and 15 minutes of waiting I call for a status update, and they tell me it will just be a few more minutes.  An HOUR after that, my food arrives--ice cold and hard, slices of cake were pathetic looking to boot.  I asked for a refund, they refused, even though I hadn't eaten any of the food.  After that I decided since I paid for it, I might as well try it.  Had to throw it all out.  Cake sickeningly sweet store-bought crap, garlic bread extremely salty. What really gets me is I ordered online, so the guy got his 20% tip anyway.  TERRIBLE service and food.
author: Leith M.

description: It's an alright pizza place. They're halal so they get an extra star for that. The pizza itself is somewhat overbearing - it's oily and that makes the plus size sausage bits very heavy and detracts from the taste of the pizza and specifically the cheese.
author: Zayd S.

description:
Terrible customer service! 
I was mugged in front of the Chico's on 6th street and afterwards my face was severely bruised and bleeding. Not only did the manager or owner or whoever refuse to let me use the phone to call the police (as my phone was stolen along with my wallet), he actually continued to serve Pizza while he and the cashier ignored my pleas for help. Only after a few minutes of me pleading did another patron phone the police for me. The staff was extremely rude during the entire time I was inside the establishment and I will NEVER be going to another Chico's again! I guess expecting the staff to act like a decent human beings is asking too much of this place
author: Tessa W.

description: Awesome pizza!! Open for delivery 3am much appreciated and the pizza was extremely good. SF Style, delivered hot and consistent all the way around. Plus the prices were more than reasonable. Thank You
author: Kevin S.

description: If I could leave less than 1 star I would.  Order was placed at 6:50pm with an estimated delivery of 7:44pm.  When It hadn't arrived by 8:10 I called.  I was assured the driver was less than 5 mins away and he just hit some traffic.  It is now 9:07pm and my pizza has still not been delivered.  I will never order from here again and you shouldn't either.
author: Emily J.

description:
They added extra mozzarella cheese on my slice of pepperoni :D

The only con is that the bathroom is yucky because Chico's seems to be an establishment oft visited by homeless folk.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Horrible food , speed of delivery and rudeness of driver.  Do not order from Chico's, here is why:

Delivery time: 45-60 minutes quoted, delivery was 2+ hours on a Tuesday night with no major games of any kind being played.  Called, said 5 minutes and it was another 30 before arrival.

Delivery person: Called that he was downstairs and that I had to come down to get it because he couldn't double park.  Total BS as everyone in SF double parks.  I find him sitting in his car, down the block and I have to walk up to him while he is still in the drivers seat of his car.  He hands me the food, and drives off before I can even complain.  Too bad I included tip already at time of order, he didn't deserve one.

Food: Horrible.  our appetizer mozzarella sticks were cold and un-edible.  The pizza itself was nowhere near fresh, and was almost cold itself.  The soda was the only thing that was supposed to be cold, yet it wasn't.

Overall: bad speed of delivery, bad delivery service and most importantly bad food!  Will not order from them again.
author: Brian C.

description: I am pretty picky about pizza, to be fair. This was adequate. The dough was too thick for my taste, but the sauce and toppings were good. It was pricey for what it was. Wouldn't go back.
author: Danielle C.

description: Just ordered a cheese pizza at 230am and they brought it straight to my hotel room. Thanks so much for being open on a Saturday night! I'll be ordering again soon!
author: Tru V.

description: Great place if you need pizza for a lot of people in downtown SF. I get this for my students every semester and they never complain. Good stuff.
author: Matty S.

description: Such an amazing pizza spot especially after a long night! Pizza is delicious and the crust is perfect. Also, and the staff is super friendly
author: Maryah B.

description: Pizza was strictly OK. The main problem was delivery it took over 2 hours to get a single pie delivered.
author: Kevin G.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite pizza spots. They knew my address and everything. Tonight I called for a pizza. One hour later I called again, but no one picked up. Then I called 5 more times to try to reach someone 20 minutes later. Finally, someone picked up and told me my order wasn't taken. Pretty terrible service if they can't take orders into account. 

Never depend on their service. That's all I say.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Ordered a pizza from Chicos last night, the best delivery pizza I've had so far in the city!

Hot, crust still crispy, all the vegetables and ingredients were very tasty!

Thanks for a great pizza!
author: Rich L.

description: No skimping on the pizza here this place does the job. Fluffy crisp thick crust done just right, toppings to the edge, right amount of cheese, the meats are flavorful, no burn marks all around delicious pizza. I also got there $4 garden salad and it was huge. I usually get delivery on Sundays and its always on time or earlier then expected. The delivery guy in the green honda civic does great service with a happy smile, right on Chico. I am a satisfied one.
author: Jojo C.

description:
Rather than contribute, I normally only consume information on Yelp. But, I had to brush the dust off my keyboard for this place. I was in San Francisco for the MacIT conference, and ate Chico's 3 times. The service was wonderful, the delivery guys were quick and friendly, and the Pizza was Awesome. Thick crust, lots of cheese, and they don't hold back on toppings.

I walked by the storefront one night on the way to a conference event, and it is in a very sketchy area of the city. Do yourself a favor and get it delivered.

Edit: 3 years later, still awesome.
author: Jeff S.

description:
This was a surprise spot for great pizza!!! Super shady location but if you're not alone and up for a yummy slice of pizza, don't skip out on this place!

I got a slice of pepperoni pizza and it was the most delicious slice I've ever had!! It tasted like it was almost home made, plenty of toppings and reallly nice big well-baked crust!!

I would highly recommend checking this pizza place out, especially after a night out in the local bars/clubs. Such a good slice after many drinks! :)

Super friendly staff and fast service!!
author: Georgiya Y.

description: As soon as I walked in they were extremely friendly and welcome to me to their pizza parlor. I proceeded up to the counter well they were more than generous and nice enough to tell me what their menu was and they were extremely friendly. By then decided to order Tuesday is the combination in 2 slices of pepperoni which is really good choices. I also asking about his choices which she was also more than enough to give me answers about. One of the best experiences I've ever had with any food place thank you very much Chicos pizza.
author: Serafin M.

description: Chico!!! Late night pizza up in the TL! It was pretty good taste wise but it's just a normal pizza. Quality is on the low end but decent food. Don't be out too late and just deliver man.
author: Dan K.

description: Good quick service. A little tight on space if you want to sit and eat here. The veggie pizza we ordered was great and had an ample quantity of all the good things. Chico's better for delivery and good for quick munching.
author: Zaki S.

description: Make sure they give you the right pizza or don't accidentally charge you twice n can't refund you. We drove all the way home in traffic to see the pizza was wrong. They claimed it was what we ordered a second pizza we were mistaken for someone else phone order which was changed. They thought we called to add a second pizza. We had to drive it all the way back get the correct one which they claim they remade but looked the same. Could have offered a bigger pizza or anything for our trouble. Shouldn't have tipped them. This is the second time they have messed up.
author: M C.

description:
This place kinda grew on me.Had a friend back in '08 who introduced me to Chico's. At first for some reason, wasn't very impressed. It was okay the first time I tried it but nothing special.

Tonight I just ordered an extra large pepperoni for my roommate and I,and gotta say it's really hitting the spot. Got here very fast...The dough tastes kinda odd/interesting at first(kinda soggy yet crispy? lol) but it's not bad combining  it with the consistancy of the sauce they use which is actually pretty good. The quality tastes kinda like Cybelle's but maybe a little better. Not the best I've ever had but definitely good for those  late night munchies. Excellent fast delivery(although personally I wouldn't ever go there..6th street not my favorite part of town)..

I would order from here again.
author: Isabella A.

description: The slices were huge..definitely got my moneys worth..every slice is literally two slices..and the pizza iz good..will be going their like 100 more times
author: A E.

description: Delivery was a little shady... Guy in unmarked SUV. But what else do you expect when you order a pizza at midnight? Pizza itself wasn't bad... But not something we would eat sober.... Nonetheless a medium veggie pizza was $16.86 - that includes free delivery.
author: Pri A.

description: Hole in the wall, New York style pizza place. Great slices, good prices. No disappointments. Love it!
author: Douglas F.

description: Pizza was really good every time I order from them i order a small veggie pizza and it be great an there open late!
author: Justin M.

description: Me and my family are not from here but we wanted to find a really good pizza place to eat. Chicos pizza are affordable and worth the pizza. And they had big pizza slices fresh and ready to go. I would definitely hit this spot but will order delivery next time because it's not a spot to eat with the family because it's small and the atmosphere around the spot is not that great.
author: Hector R.

description: One of the last bastions of cheap, filling pizza that doesn't taste like cardboard and melted plastic.
author: Kaleena S.

description: The best slice south of market. Very friendly staff and the food is tasty and a good value. They're open late and they deliver too.
author: Jon S.

description: I've been going to Chicos for YEARS!! They've always had the BEST pizza!! ....until now. This is the second pizza I've ordered this month that was a completely different recipe. My favorite thing about Chico's was their fluffy crust! Not on their delivery pizzas! They now cook the pizza with cheap thin overcooked crust. It was just like an ordinary oven pizza. The strange thing is if you order by the slice in person, its still the great old recipe. The delivery pizza is mediocre at best..
author: David I.

description: I ordered 5 pizzas for delivery for a group of hungry high schoolers. I ordered online-- very easy and great deals & coupons-- and was able to select a delivery time that worked best for me. Arrived on time, the delivery person was helpful, and the pizza was pretty tasty!
author: Moni E.

description:
Facts are: I'm lazy. I work late at night. Same with the boyfriend. So we have often settled for mediocre late-night delivery places because we get home after 2am, and if there's nothing in the fridge, what else can you do?

But Chico's! I'm not sure when exactly they started appearing on my options for Eat24, but it has changed our lives. We are happier, kinder to each other, better-looking, and our libidos are out of control!... I mean -- this place is magic.

The pizza is excellent. Their sandwiches are delicious and piled HIGH with everything you want (particularly the Big Daddy sandwich - omnomnom). They have Snapple. They are incredibly obliging about special requests. 

Sometimes they run out of the Snapple you asked for, but what does Fernando (the most wonderful delivery guy EVER) do? He apologizes for the lack of, say, Peach Snapple, and presents you with a *BAG* of ice cold drinks to choose from. Actually, I assumed he was "Chico" himself until I asked his name last night, just because his customer service is outstanding and he truly seems to appreciate our patronage in a way that you generally only get from an owner or manager.

Love this place.
author: Tracy B.

description: DO. NOT. ORDER FROM THIS PLACE!!!!! The delivery guy never came! He just never came. And I called the restaurant to find out why my pizza hasn't arrived after 2 hours and the guy answered, immediately started yelling at me, and hung up. He says "my guy call you 3 time and I call you." No bud, you didn't. No one called me. My apartment is ON the street... Knock? I get it, you're mad. But probably don't act like a huge baby and treat me like a monster, it's just pizza.  Eat24 rules and refunded my money, but I advise you to order from anywhere else. In the event something goes wrong you should order from a place that'll be on your team.
author: Lucy L.

description: This place is the bomb! Affordable price with large slice of very delicious pizza! Plus they open till pretty late! Love it!
author: Al L.

description: Came here after a night at Monarch, we ordered and literally a few minutes after we ordered people we receiving pizzas that ordered after us. Long story short they put our pizza in the oven and gave it to someone else or just forgot about it and tried to say that we didn't order anything and that we were trying to take advantage of them being busy and trying to get free pizza. On top of that, the pizza sucked.
author: Onkar G.

description: Free delivery, to my hotel, fifteen minutes earlier than anticipated and super delicious! Delivery guy stated "this is my best pizza" and dude was not exaggerating!
author: Pearl S.

description:
Chico's Special: a LARGE combination pizza style for just $3.00 
Fresh, delicious, and cheap pizza -- just the kind you search for in these hole-in-walls! 

Staff is very friendly as they are working late hours. Plus: free ranch, can't argue with that.
author: Briget P.

description:
It's a small spot without much room, but it's worth a visit.

They sell by the slice (which really appeals to me since that's the Jersey way) or by the pie, so you can get dinner to go or just have a snack while walking down the street.

The fellow behind the counter was friendly and the service was quick.  I had the combination pizza and really enjoyed it.  Being from the Northeast, I tend to prefer thin crust so I can fold my slice in half, but this slightly thicker crust was tasty.  The fellow described it as Chicago Style, but I would put it closer to a Chicago / New York fusion.

If you're walking down the street and need a bite to eat, I suggest stopping in for a slice.
author: Christopher J.

description: Very good pizza. I ordered delivery for a large group in SF after a recommendation, and we weren't disappointed.
author: Adamme K.

description:
These guys are awesomely fast for delivery.  Even their basic cheese pizza does it for me.  Very well priced, friendly and very accommodating. 

Definitely, suggest for a busy parents with 2 crazed children seeking pizza.  They are my kid's favs.
author: Kim A.

description:
Delivery took 2 hours and driver was rude!

After not being able to find the door of my building entrance I came down to meet him and he handed me the pizza with an angry expression and no words exchanged. As he walked away I could hear him cussing in frustration. 

Pizza was average - too doughy and bland. Taste improved a little when I warmed the cold delivery in the oven. Wings were not good either. I would definitely not order from Chico's again and wish I had listened to the other yelpers who had a similar experience with a long wait and rude delivery person. 

If this is your first time ordering, consider me you from the future and save yourself the pain.
author: Joe P.

description: I loved the great pizza and delicious buffalo wings !!!!! I was at work and ordered for delivery. Delivery person very good service and over the phone they where very helpful thank you Chicos !!!! Next time I think of pizza at work will think of Chicos
author: Sabritas E.

description:
Stopped in on Saturday November 10th, 2012 before the Red Bull event. 

Ordered the $5 slice and drink combo. The pesto slice was a cheese slice that was already made - and then had the toppings added to it when you ordered and then recooked in the oven before being served.

As I attempted to eat the slice - one of the most disgusting homeless people I have ever seen in my life with no shoes on entered the facility and stood next to me. I nearly threw up - and walked out unable to finish the 1/2 of slice that was left. 

Overall, this might have been one of the worse slices of pizza I have ever ate in my life and I doubt I will ever be back.
author: Brian D.

description: came here after a late night out and omg so good. their pizza is delicious. even ordered for my office after we tried it the first time. definitely recommend
author: Paulina L.

description:
"Perfect drunk food" is a phrase we often use for Chico's slices.

Hot slices, large toppings, cheap prices - one of the best simple slice joints in my hometown.
author: Charles L.

description:
After I left Mezzanine around 1ish, everybody was kind of marching down the alley like Zombies... turn the corner and march down 6th the street past Monarch and people are going into Chico's, so I'm like, yeah, I'll go. It's 24/7, which is great... because I. WAS. HUNGRY!!!!!!!!!  

I was pissed off because 3 guys walking in before me and one of them was one of those indecisive mofos that sits there going "uuuuuhhhhh... ummm..." for like 10 minutes. So his friends ordered real quick. This gave me time to decide want I wanted: Pepperoni, and the Supreme one with bell peppers sausage, pepperoni, and all that. 

So Now I'm hungry and even this guy's friends are like "Come one man just decide...." and the two guys behind the counter are like "Just decide.... please we have other customers waiting..." So finally it was my turn and I ordered and I got the pizza slices (which are huge by the way), and a Snapple.I like the fact all the drinks are in the fridge and they are ICE COLD.  It came out to a little under $10, so the young man said, I' going to add the $23 cents to make it an even $10. At first I was "Huh?", but then I was like whatever... plus I understand and most places have limits anyways... and businesses get charged for every card transaction so...whatever.  If that bothers you, pay cash. :) But I brought $4 with me on this whole trip, lol. 

The pizza was hot and I could've even stayed to eat and watch tv on a booth but I just decided to take my food and enjoy it in my room across the street. :)
It came in a cute little pizza box and when I got back to my room and sat on the bed and ate that pizza, and drank that ice cold Snapple I was in heaven. The cheese was very gooey and good. It is not the healthiest... I mean it is pizza! But it really hit the spot, so thank you Chico's pizza. 

And... why are people complaining about the neighborhood. I'm getting tired of it on every page that belongs to a SOMA business. Ok... the Tenderloin is close by; there are homeless people in every state in every city. They never bother me or even beg. Get over yourselves please...
author: Chrissy O.

description:
For what it is Chico's is great. They make a great simple pizza, if you want bone marrow I think you should look elsewhere but if you want a basic pizza with sausage and pepperoni this is the spot. 

The neighborhood isn't great, call in your order if you want a whole pizza this is not the place you want to stand around at for 20 minutes. And be ready for random people on the street to ask you for a slice on your walk home or car. 

The pizza is what I am used to from the midwest, not fancy but good. Lots of cheese and toppings and a low amount of sauce compared to most pizza places in SF. The crust/dough isn't to die for but it's decent. 

Overall this is a superb late night pizza to go place.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Pizza took well over an hour but took it anyway as in starvation mode. Delivery Guy was friendly at any rate. Price for large pep not bad but had better pizza in terms of taste.
author: j m.

description: Ya know, their pizza and their calzones are delicious, but I really dislike dealing with the delivery driver's attitude when I received my calzone. I specifically asked in the EAT24 app to please leave me a large cup of marina sauce. They always forget the marina sauce. I ask the delivery driver if they had it, and he responds with saying there's marina in the calzone, and proceeds to name the price of the pizza for the second time, as if brushing off my inquiry. That's not what I asked for, and secondly, there's no marina in the calzone I ordered. There's not supposed to be any marina in a calzone anyways, or else I might as well order a damn pizza. Is it wrong to enjoy my calzone with a cup of marina sauce I can dip or slather with? Again, Chico's Pizza has some good, tasty food, but those 2/5 stars is for the delivery driver putting me on edge. Maybe I'll change this review once I stop feeling so damn annoyed.
author: Maleia M.

description:
This place is literally the worst. I ordered a sandwich and a side of cheesy bread and they gave me an estimate of 45 minute wait time. After an hour passed, I called to see if my order would be here soon and the guy on the phone said the driver was a couple of minutes away.

After another 15 minutes passed I called again and he said the driver was down stairs. 10 minutes later, the doorbell rang and the driver was there with my food. 

I open it up, and SHOCK, my food is cold and stale. I take a bite of the sandwich to see if its any better than the bread which you can see right off the bat is disgusting and it was just as bad.

I call the restaurant and ask them to refund the food, and he says he can only refund it if it is untouched.

I was shocked! I had just waited TWICE as long as they had told me, and then they brought me ice cold and stale food and refused to refund it since I had tried it.

DO NOT EAT HERE!!!
author: Marta Y.

description:
Three stars because the pizza is good. But it takes forever! I live a little
Over 4 blocks away and it's been over 80 minutes. That is ridiculous. 
Crust is very good. Wings are pretty good but stick to the foil too much. 

Definite room to improve on delivery times.

Edit. 1 star. I called to ask where the pizza was and they didn't seem to care.
author: Dakin G.

description: Not the best location but hella good pizza/food! Some people are complaining about a weird taste. That is the seasoning in the sauce, i like it but it does have a unique taste which makes chicos pizza different than all the others. There garlic cheese bread w/o sauce is bomb though and hella affordable.
author: B C.

description: Good, cheap and opened late. Happy I found this place and will order here again. We ordered through Seamless and the pizza arrived quickly.
author: Zona P.

description: Fast delivery very good sandwiches (( pizza yummy )) I love this place (:
author: Khaleel A.

description: I thought Fat Slice in Berkeley or Nazarrios in the Castro was good, but OMG if you want a fresh pizza by the slice, without paying an arm and a leg for it (combo slice $3.50), come here. The slices are thick and nicely topped. Yum
author: Josh S.

description:
Truly a real pizzeria. Whether you are trying to just buy a quick slice to go, a whole pizza, or even a full pizza, sandwhich, salad, desert, and a drink for a party Kaleel is the pizza king with a wonderful set of staff that always will come through to make a masterpiezza worthy of being placed into a museum of beautiful pizza. Not only is the pizza made by true artists, but the quality of the ingredients are top quality. Finally the most important quality is the dough and crust, which comes out crispy on the outside, puffed up to a huge easy to hold size, holds the pizza together great, and is soft and fluffy on the inside with the most delicious crust taste.

I usually just get a pepperoni slice, but if I want something really dank I pay the extra to add extra pepperoni to end up with those crispy delicious pepperonis. I might even add salami on top too. The chicos special is quite a delicious combo, but I am a bit finicky and don't eat the veggies. When I get a whole pizza I order Eat24 and get the X-large three topping special with pep, salami, and mushroom asking for more pep than salami and more meats than mushroom. The pizza always comes out beautiful and bomb especially after I do the final touch adding herbs, parm, salt & pepper, and finally adding just a touch more of herbs that I let sit and become cooked in, melted, and delicious.

This place is also just a great spot for the community. Sixth street is not the nicest of areas yet that doesn't stop chicos from being a place with wonderful atmosphere. Besides Kaleel and the rest of the friendly staff making sure that your experience is the best it can be in what little space they have available to work with. Surprisingly there is somehow space for a bathroom for customers if needed and the store itself is decorated with sports memorabilia as well as chicos pizza history. I highly recommend taking the time to check it all out next time your there waiting for a pizza. They definitely put effort into designing their store and it totally deserves to be appreciated.
author: Max G.

description: The pizza is really good, my only gripe is that when you get it delivered is only moderately warm upon arrival.  I have had it delivered 10+ times (and I live 2 blocks away) and only once has the pizza been hot, or to my liking.  It is really quality pizza though so I would definitely recommend to anyone.
author: Day L.

description: The absolute BEST BBQ Chicken Pizza ever!!! It's not on the menu, it's a hidden treasure, so just ask for it!!!!
author: Francesca C.

description:
to all the people complaining about ambience: it's at 6th and mission. what did you expect? gary danko?

the pizza here is AMAZING. they're open late, so i like to stop there on my way back from a night out. they have the best veggie slice in sf. veggie is my faaaavorite, and they do it well. the crust is great, and they have all the stuff i like on it. they're one of the few places that has figured out how to put fresh tomatoes on a pizza without making it soggy.

i've never had delivery, but i've heard that this is one of the few places that will deliver to treasure island, which is convenient if you live out there.

the only thing is...yeah, it's at 6th and mission. there are some interesting characters there. i only go after dark if i'm with people, or able to park right out front. but there's nothing the restaurant can do about the people on the street.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Cheap and tasty pizza! The wings are very good too. We had to wait 10 mins or so for our order but that was okay because then you know they're making it fresh. We got ours take out but they do have some seating. This place is busy and deservedly popular.
author: Lauren T.

description: Ordered the cheese pizza.  Wow! Seasoned perfectly with a sweet crust that was crispy on the outside and soft n'chewy on the inside.  Sooooo good.salad was awesome and poppers were fair.  Delivery driver, as well, was professional, kind and handsome.
author: Jonathan T.

description: Scary area, expect to get pestered for change and to feel enormous guilt walking past all the homeless people with a big box of pizza.  Good place to go when you're in a hurry and only have $5.00.  You can get a slice of pizza and a drink.
author: Carrie M.

description: If you want classic pizza that had been a tradition of San Francisco for over two decades, this is your place.
author: M M.

description:
I placed my order around 8:10PM and my calzone was ready (though I never received any missing calls) around 8:50PM which is pretty good on a Tuesday night. As I never received the call about my order, I called the restaurant around 9:30PM and they said they would re-deliver but the calzone was already cold.I don't mind cold calzone since I can always heat it up in my oven anyway.

Once I got the calzone, I only heated it up for a few minutes since I was too hungry to wait! I must say, the semi-cold/warm calzone was good and I definitely will re-order soon again to try the hot calzone or pizza soon!
author: Bergen H.

description: Ordered pizza delivery from them for a movie night at our dorms. It was easy to order and they looked pretty good! Plus we could get 2 18 inch pizzas for like $30. We ordered a pepperoni and a cheese pizza because we had some vegetarian friends. Unfortunately, after the delivery came I realized that they sent us 2 pepperoni. I called immediately after and told the gentleman what had happened and he promptly made us a new pizza and delivered it within 30 minutes for free! I would have paid for a new one but the business went out of their way for us tonight. Mistakes happen! Plus the pizza was yummy with a super chewy crust! Will recommend to everyone.
author: N S.

description: An amazing place to stop and fill up on a busy day in SOMA. Everyone is very friendly and the food tastes great and smells amazing.
author: Kamal G.

description: Despite this Pizza place being a bit trashy and in an incredibly dodgy area on 6th Street, I am in LOVE with their Pizza. I think it's one of my favourites in San Francisco. Especially when it is fresh. I find it totally addicting. From their cheese, to pep, to veg, to even the Hawaiian Pizza... its quite yummy. They accept EBT as well and its quite reasonable for the price. If I lived in the neighbourhood (thank heaven's I do not!) I'd be ordering take-away pies often. Not sure if they do delivery. Chicos is incredibly necessary to businesses around the area and as much as I fear 6th street its a jungle and its nice to have a really good Pizza shop on 6th. Much better than the other one across the street!
author: Julian I.

description: Had a late night craving and this place hit the spot. Cheap and tasty! Delivered at estimated time and delivery person was in and out.
author: Raya R.

description:
Got pizza delivered to our hotel for a quick bite before we all headed out to the clubs. The pizza here is okay. Not the best, but not the worst. The thickness of the pizza was good and it was crispy. We got the cheese, supreme and pesto chicken. I liked the cheese the most, because it had a good consistency of cheese to sauce. 

Overall, the pizza was decent. I'd order from here again.
author: Vi L.

description: HANDS DOWN, BEST PIZZA BY THE SLICE IN SF!!!  I have been a fan of this place for over 10 years even back when they were located on Mission street.  I believe that they might have changed owners since then but the quality of the pizza remains the same.  I always order the Vegetarian with grilled chicken stripes.  They never skimp on the chicken and they slice is so massive that one slice is always enough.  A slice of pizza with a drink is less than $5.  Yes, the location is in a very sketchy neighborhood,  so I never come alone.   However, every time I bring someone new to this place, they are always impress with the pizza.
author: Eva E.

description: I would eat here every day of the week if I could. This is as good, and unapologetic as pizza should be. Don't worry about ambiance here, the food is killer. Not pretentious, not pretty, just tasty, cheesy, goodness. There is nothing better than a late night slice of their pepperoni pizza, or shamefully eating a large all by one's lonesome as the ultimate guilty pleasure. Would recommend everybody try food here. Sooooooo good.
author: Dan C.

description: The pizza was okay. The pepperoni was sparse and uneven. Overall, it probably wasn't worth the hour and a half wait.
author: David H.

description:
Wait, seriously?!

I went for a walk the other day and somehow ended up in the middle of sixth street, which for anyone, it's a scandalous place.

I was hungry and adventurous so i decided to try this place because the guy inside.gave me a friendly, compassionate smile.

It turns out, when someone is just genuinely friendly...THEY.HAVE.THE.BEST.FRICKIN.PIZZA.ON.EARTH.

I know it sounds crazy. But there are actually really hard working honest people out there. You jusy have to look for the clues.
author: Nick L.

description: Delivery was quicker than expected on a Friday night (45-60 mins expected, delivered in 30). Pizza was the best I've had to date in SF. Delivery guy was friendly. Would recommend
author: Luke C.

description: We ordered online and they have taken an hour and a half. We still havent received our food. I called in a half an hour ago and they said it would be 10 to 15 minutes. I would NOT recommend this restaurant.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Good prices, decent pizza.

Not a huge fan of the dough they use here. In my experience, the crust has always had a good crunch on the outside and was really soft and airy on the inside. However, i'm choosing to use 'airy' to also describe the fact that the crust actually tastes like air. Not much flavor at all. The stuff on the top was yummy, though.

The 6th Street Crackheads™ don't really help raise the rating for this place, either.
author: Jay A.

description: First, when I called to place my order, the guy claimed he had no idea where I lived. Like, that's what a GPS is for? Next, they said it'd only take 45min-1hour to deliver. As soon as an hour had passed I called the place, asking how much longer my order would be, and they said no order was placed!! My friend decided to call and place an order AGAIN after they said we didnt, and when he started telling the address, the man asked if we had already placed an order an hour a little bit earlier! We explained what happened and he said that the food was on its way. It came 10 min later. It was soggy, and they didn't give me the right flavor of wings. Service and food were extremely poor. I would NOT recommend this place. I am very unsatisfied.
author: Cristina C.

description:
Chico's is my favorite pizza in SF. If you are willing to brave 6'th street and the clientele that it brings, you will not be sorry for trying Chico's. 
Staff is friendly and recognizes me every time. Slices come out fast and hot, with the crust just the slightest bit doughy. Great prices.
author: Bobby B.

description: Very bad service. Have been waiting for almost 20 min and they serve pizza from people that ordered after us. Will never recommend this place.  The cashier was rude also.
author: Jacob U.

description:
Sixth and Mission is not really a place you should consider as a late night destination (unless your late night plans involve crack and street hookers). If you do end up in the area though (mistakes happen) and you want hot, cheap, greasy pizza, Chico's is there for you. The staff is nice, they stay open late, and the slices are big enough that I can get stuffed off just two of them. Is it stellar pizza? No. Will your arteries thank you? No. Is it still a great value at a low cost? Hell yes! Even though Chico's can still be enjoyed sober, all of the above make it quintessential drunk food. 

Let's face it, if you can stomach making the walk to Chico's, you'll probably enjoy stomaching some of their pizza.
author: Keith M.

description:
- 2.5 Stars - 

Tip - Leave your valuables at home and bring cash.  

Chico's was a block from the hotel and my friend and I wanted to put some heavy food in the stomach before a concert at the Warfield and a night of excessive drinking.  

$3 pepperoni slice - Neither NY or Chicago style, more of a Costco-esque crust with decent flavor and texture.  The pizza itself was okay, possibly warranting three stars.  However, I probably would not return, as much because of the shady ass people lurking around this establishment.  6th and Mission is intense.
author: Sam H.

description: The regular pizza was too doughey/sweet for my tastes. Sauce had potential, but needed more. Kind of like Papa Johns. Nice delivery guy - a real booster of the organization. Really want to try the thin crust next time. Have faith it will be improved.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I'm basing this review on a turkey sandwich, which all things in life should be measured by anyway.

Turkey sandwich was really good. It's warm and toasted, had layers and layers of turkey, and doused in flavorful sauce. Plus, it was only $5. Worth it.


I've had pizza from here before, too, and was thoroughly satisfied from it. I'm not a pizza connoisseur, so I can't say it was the best or worst pizza out there, but it was definitely good and didn't dissuade me from returning to get more. I can't really describe how the pizza tasted (guess it wasn't memorable), so my 4/5 is pretty much about the turkey sandwich.
author: Robin I.

description: Awesome pizza.  Awesome price.  Well rounded deal. Don't let the neighborhood scare you away.
author: A R M.

description: Found them on Eat24, this is now my "regular" place for pizza. Good portions and fresh ingredients... no fake Italian sausage.  Yummiest crust, too.  Their prices is the best part!  I'm a satisfied customer.  Thank you!
author: Lawree S.
